Two questions here:
Does this mean we perform two operations on SQL? A lookup and the a delete? Performance wise that’s probably okay for our delete API. Might have implications for atomicity of the operation.
Second more important - should we fire an event on the observe method here? Would the sync engine care about observing this case?

Does this mean we perform two operations on SQL? A lookup and the a delete?

This lookup is already performed in save to determine whether item should be created or updated. There hasn't been an issue there so far, so it will be fine.

should we fire an event on the observe method here?

No change took place in the database, so I don't see the need for the sync engine to worry about it.
